review_text: I had a great stay here ! This was also probably the cleanest Air BnB Iâ€™ve ever stayed in and Rui was so responsive to my messages and questions. She even checked in with me to ask how my stay was going. The only downsides were some things out of our control, like the sound of the train at night is pretty loud and as a renter of one of the downstairs rooms, sometimes the sound of renters upstairs was loud, too. Otherwise, the room & house was in a really nice & safe area, there was plenty of parking, Rui was responsive, and the room felt very cosy and well taken care of. There was also an extra personal heater or fan in the room if needed, lots of closet & storage provided, and all the promised amenities on the advertised airbnb post were there too. I would definitely love to stay in one of Ruiâ€™s rooms again!

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: We love coming here and it is closer to work for me when I have to leave at 5 am. Hosts are friendly and talkative yet respectful of our privacy. Great parking. I like having full access to use the kitchen. There are clear instructions of where we can put our food in the cupboard and/or fridge and which items you can use. There is coffee and an ice maker. The house is gorgeous, spacious, and clean. There is space in the closet to hang clothes. The washer and dryer available for use until 11 pm. The shower is a little narrow, so it wouldn't be a good fit for someone with a larger frame or for someone who has mobility issues. There is shampoo, body wash, toothpaste/brushes, and hand soap for use. 5 stars *****

review_text:
Stacyâ€™s home is very clean, well decorated and private. We needed a four bedroom to come to Modesto for our daughterâ€™s wedding, and we were able to rent the whole house. There are door locks with codes, presumably to rent out on an individual basis as well. Everything that one would need is at your fingertips. The house has pleasant greenery surrounding the property, which gives the yard a feeling of privacy. There are even two outdoor seating areas.
Guests should read the site rules carefully and decide if the home fits their needs. Be sure to ask Stacy questions before renting the home. Stacy quickly responded to my messages clarifying any confusion regarding the rules. Although the site said she allowed pets, in fact, she does not allow pets, specifically dogs, for this property.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a great place for a 3-4 people...it sleeps 6, but that might be a stretch with the 2 bathrooms. In fact, we were surprised to see 3 bedrooms; we thought it was 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. It was very nice and clean, but lacked some small amenities that would have made it more comfortable--kleenex, luggage racks or a dresser, hand soap at the kitchen sink, enough toilet paper. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes, cooking utensils and spices. It was pretty obvious, however, that a tall person either built or rehabbed it; I had to stand on my toes to reach the microwave and the second level shelves. I'm 5'4". The TV was not easy to figure out and I couldn't find CNN until the last day we were there, but we may be less technologically oriented than some. The outside area was very nice with a working barbeque and a table and 4 chairs. Extra chairs were placed in another spot outside. Overall, a good value for the money.

We very much enjoyed the onsite parking so we could easily see my car, as well as the self locking front door. Would recommend^^

Stayed with kids
review_text: Angela is a great host. She communicates very well. The house was very clean and exactly as described. I appreciated that she included extra towels based on how many people would be there during our stay (we had 4 adults and 3 children). The kitchen is decently stocked with what you would expect from an Air BnB. There were plenty of mugs, plates, bowls, silverware, etc. Some of the pots and pans were in better shape than others, but at least she had some available. We were able to cook some of our meals during our stay to save some money. She had some spices available, which is always nice. The house is located in a neighborhood on a dead end street, so it was very quiet and there is quite a bit in the area. The grocery store is walkable from the house and it was very nice. There is also a sushi restaurant nearby that we also enjoyed. Overall, we would definitely stay at Angelaâ€™s place again

review_text:
This was a great place for us while were visiting relatives in Modesto. It is conveniently located; near stores, restaurants and main roads. It is in a gated community and we felt very safe.
Laurie's instructions were very well written, so we had no problem finding the location and getting in was easy.
The kitchen and living areas were neat and clean. There were some games and puzzles that we enjoyed. The kitchen was spacious and had a great assortment of utensils and cookware.
We only used the master bedroom and the bed was very comfortable. All the bedrooms were a good size. The bathrooms also were nice and had plenty of hot water.
Laurie was attentive and checked in via text. She responded quickly each time I texted and I felt like I could ask her anything. We have stayed at several places around town and this was one of my favorites.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
The townhome is spacious and laid out well. The kitchen is really big and easy to work in. It is centrally located to the major highway and lots of retail.
There was one glaring problem. The smell of cigarette smoke permeated the entire property. We used three bottles of Fabreeze on the fabrics in the house and out clothing and it did little to help. We were forced to open all the windows whenever we were in the house. The owner told us that this was from the previous tenant, and she was contacting Air B&B about them. I did not and do not believe that. I was a smoker and grew up with smokers. The kind of saturation that we experienced does not happen over a week. It was disappointing that the owner would not waive the cleaning fee. It is my opinion that the house was not clean when we entered because of the heavy smoke smell
That is our only complaint.

review_text: Jack and Ginger's place is lovely. It's a great little oasis in a good spot - right off the Virginia Corridor Trail and bike path that feeds into downtown Modesto and connects a few parks. That was the main reason we wanted to stay here. It's also just around the corner from a grocery store (O'Briens), frozen yogurt place, and some restaurants. The home is a 1 bedroom ADU with a spacious bathroom - there's a small seating area combined with the kitchenette right when you enter. Very tastefully decorated that manages to get a lot of natural light. But because it is south-facing, it also stays very cool. It felt very airy and comfortable, and it was also very quiet. The ADU sits behind a gate and has its own entrance. It was very easy to check in and a really quiet and cozy stay.

There are many good things to say about this AirBnB location. The location is convenient for traveling. My wife and I attended a conference in a town approximately 20 minutes from this little oasis. We felt safe, warm, and welcome. They
Ginger, the host kept in good communication before, during, and after our stay. They provided a few snacks for us to enjoy and clean linens, towels, and the place was immaculate.
The only thing I recommend is a larger bed. The double bed is cute, but it's small. There is enough room for a queen or even a king. This would make their place a perfect spot to land while visiting the area.
Thank you, Ginger, for a lovely stay. There is an outdoor pool and cabana that looked very inviting, minus the cold temperatures outside. We didn't use it mainly due to our travel itinerary, but if we had more time I would have definitely enjoyed this nice little bonus.

review_text: This was a very thoughtful rental experience. The attention to most details was apparent and the space was cohesive and efficient. The entrance is in the side/backyard of the attached house and secluded but not completely separate from the area where the dog can walk; a few times we were awoken by the dog barking but it wasnâ€™t constant, just surprising. When we first arrived the AC/Heating unit did not turn on. We did not contact the host because the weather was nice at first but realized when it got cooler at night it would have been nice. It almost seemed like a breaker had been flipped because the next day it was working (could have easily been user error, and like I said we didnâ€™t attempt to contact the host.) It was nice to have the washer and dryer, the rain-style shower head was fabulous, and there was certainly plenty of space to move around with two people, even when getting ready in the bathroom at the same time. Overall a positive experience.

name: Amy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I stayed here for the week while visiting to care for family, which because of the pandemic was a very stressful trip -- but thankfully, I had everything I needed for a comfortable stay in Ginger and Jack's place. The living room space was especially nice, because I could relax there with a family member (wearing masks, of course) to watch a movie in a quiet and comfortable space. We also made use of the outdoor table and chairs. You can tell that the owners put a lot of care into every detail, and the space looks just as pictured. I especially appreciated the complimentary kurig coffee maker and coffee pods! These little touches helped my stay feel more like a home away from home. The neighborhood is lovely and filled with beautiful homes and a walking path nearby, along with a local market, O'Brien's, a few blocks away that came in really handy for meals and coffee! The only thing I might mention is that if you are tall, the bed will be short -- I am 5'5 and it was okay for me, but my husband is 6' and if he had travelled with me I know he would have been uncomfortable. There is a couch that converts to a bed, and it is longer, so I suppose a tall person could use that if needed. All in all I would absolutely stay here again if I need to travel to Modesto in the future. I recommend!

review_text: This location was perfect for the area of town we wanted. Roseburg Square, a block down the street, has a few of the best options in town- Bob's take and bake pizza, O'briens grocery store and Yogurt Mill yogurt! Also, the Virginia Corridor is a nice walking path nearby. This air b n b overall was a nice place to stay, ideally for 1-2 people because of the full size bed. The air conditioning unit is a plug-in unit in the bedroom so the small living room in front doesn't receive much cool air. The bedroom and bathroom were very spacious. There is no tv in the bedroom and no cable. Even though the home/air b n b is located on a somewhat busy street, we did not hear the traffic inside. The neighbors were very nice. Overall, a simple and clean place to stay.

Gingerâ€™s place was super clean and comfortable. Easy check-in and lots of nice little touches to the place made my stay very enjoyable.
Bathroom is amazing and the washer/dryer in the unit was very nice and useful amenity to have.
Onsite parking and own private entrance.
Centrally located near Roseburg Square and the Virginia trail, it makes a great place to stay at while in Modesto.
No issues at all during my stay and Ginger was super communicative whenever I had a question. Would recommend.
